ei.service.normenv
Class NormEnvBehaviour

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.behaviours.Behaviour
      jade.core.behaviours.SimpleBehaviour
          jade.core.behaviours.CyclicBehaviour
              ei.service.normenv.NormEnvBehaviour
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class NormEnvBehaviour
extends jade.core.behaviours.CyclicBehaviour

Class that implements the normative environment behaviour.
This behaviour will run the Jess engine.

Author:
hlc
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

NormEnvBehaviour

public NormEnvBehaviour(NormativeEnvironment ne,
                        NormEnvJessGUI neGUI)
Creates a NormEnvBehaviour instance with a default Jess filename.

Parameters:
ne - The Normative Environment that adds the behaviour.
neGUI - The Normative Environment's GUI

NormEnvBehaviour

public NormEnvBehaviour(NormativeEnvironment ne,
                        java.lang.String jessFile,
                        NormEnvJessGUI neGUI)
Creates a NormEnvBehaviour instance. The Jess file to load may be a Jess source code file (with a .clp extension) or a Jess serialized state file.

Parameters:
ne - The Normative Environment that adds the behaviour.
jessFile - The name of the Jess file to be loaded.
neGUI - The Normative Environment's GUI
Method Detail

onStart

public void onStart()
Sets up the normative environment (Jess engine). Note: in the past I had some problems with having this inside onStart(), and moved it to this behaviour's constructor. I think the problem was related with getting notifications from the DF regarding new agents, which asserts facts into Jess, and if Jess is not initialized yet I get an exception. However, the problem seems to have disappeared... :|

Overrides:
onStart in class jade.core.behaviours.Behaviour

newIllocution

protected boolean newIllocution(jade.lang.acl.ACLMessage msg)
Handles a new illocution arrival, asserting it into the Jess engine as a brute fact.

Parameters:
msg - The message that has arrived.

newAgents

protected boolean newAgents(jade.domain.FIPAAgentManagement.DFAgentDescription[] ags)
Handles new agents and their services/roles, updating the corresponding Jess facts.

Parameters:
ags - The agent descriptions; for each agent with service changes, a collection of all currently holding services is received

newContract

protected boolean newContract(ContractWrapper cw)
Handles a new contract to monitor, asserting it into the Jess engine.
Note that this method is tightly coupled with the XML contract XSD. Any changes to the XSD imply changes in the JAXB generated classes, which will likely require changes here... --> TODO: This method needs extensive testing!

Parameters:
cw - The wrapped contract to monitor.
Returns:
true if the contract parsed ok, false if something went wrong and the contract was not added to the Jess engine

saveEnvState

public void saveEnvState()
Saves the state of the Rete engine.
